article.title: Lockheed Martin to Support GPS III
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Lockheed Martin Corporation, Space System Company, Newtown, Pennsylvania, is being awarded a $67,961,418 cost-plus-fixed-fee contract to provide on-orbit operations engineering support research and development of GPS III space vehicles One and Two. Space and Missile Center Global Positioning System, El Segundo, California, is the contracting activity.
